did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gail and Stephen Rudin slavery collection, 1728-1973.
did.physdesc: Newspaper engravings, estate appraisals, wills, legal documents, manumissions, correspondence, sheet music, slave taxation records, stereoviews, newspapers
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The Gail and Stephen Rudin Slavery Collection consists of newspaper engravings, estate appraisals, wills, legal documents, manumissions, reward for capture of runaway slave advertisements, slave dealer and slave trade manuscripts, correspondence, sheet music, slave taxation records, stereoviews and other records documenting the sale, hire, purchase and debt payment of slaves in 18th and 19th century America.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The Gail and Stephen Rudin Slavery Collection consists of newspaper engravings, estate appraisals, wills, legal documents, manumissions, reward for capture of runaway slave advertisements, slave dealer and slave trade manuscripts, correspondence, sheet music, slave taxation records, stereoviews and other records documenting the sale, hire, purchase and debt payment of slaves in 18th and 19th century America.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: United States, Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gail and Stephen Rudin slavery collection, #4681. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
